meanings.definition: To rally in opposition or response to an initial rally.
meanings.sent1: The team counterrallied after falling behind in the game.
meanings.sent2: She counterrallied with a strong argument against the proposed changes.
meanings.sent3: The students counterrallied by organizing a fun protest with music and banners.
meanings.sent4: His determination counterrallied any doubts that he would succeed.
meanings.sent5: The community counterrallied against the construction of the new highway, showing unity and strength.

meanings.sent1: They counterrallied last week to support the cause.
meanings.sent2: After the event, they counterrallied to celebrate their success.
meanings.sent3: The group counterrallied and reminisced about their past victories.
meanings.sent4: She counterrallied with enthusiasm, showing her dedication to the team.
meanings.sent5: The crowd counterrallied with cheers and applause, showing their appreciation for the performers.
